page.title: 11Tour of Old Warslow
page.content: Warslow used to have many more shops. The house below the Middle and First schools was once a joiner's shop before it became a farm. Continuing down Leek Road, the second house down from the Greyhound pub was once a local book repairer's shop, but that closed about 30 years ago. Smithy Cottage, opposite Church Terrace used to be a shop selling sweets and tobacco. Coming back up the quarter, Grouse Farm was once a public house to which the Ecton lead miners used to come. A boy used to tap dance and perhaps get a penny. This was in the 1880s and before.
